intro: Hoehnelia macrocephala, commonly known as the giant-headed peacock flower, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter, featuring vibrant red and yellow hues. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Hoehnelia macrocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and eye-catching floral display.
